required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Chemotherapy Treatment for Patients With Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Study of LY573636-Sodium as Treatment for Patients With Platinum-Resistant Ovarian Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to determine whether LY573636-sodium (hereafter referred to as LY573636) is effective in treating platinum-resistant ovarian cancer. Patients will receive an intravenous infusion of study drug once every 28 days. Computed tomography (CT) scans and CA-125 tests will be done before the first dose and then after every other treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response and Partial Response (Objective Response Rate)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to measured progressive disease up to 12.68 months
primary_outcome.description: Objective response is complete response (CR) + partial response (PR), as classified by the investigators according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Objective response rate is calculated as a total number of participants with CR or PR divided by the total number of participants treated multiplied by 100.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to measured progressive disease or death due to any cause up to 21.26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from date of first dose to the first observation of progression of disease (PD) or death due to any cause. PD was determined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. PD is ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions and/or a new lesion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response, Partial Response, and Stable Disease (Clinical Benefit Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to measured progressive disease up to 21.26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Benefit Rate is complete response (CR) + partial response (PR) + stable disease (SD) as classified by the investigator according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. SD is neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease. Clinical benefit rate is calculated as a total number of participants with CR or PR or SD divided by the total number of participants treated multiplied by 100.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to 2 hours postdose in Cycles 1 and 2
First treatment to death due to any cause up to 42.91 months
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from date of first treatment to the date of death due to any cause. For participants who were alive, overall survival was censored at their last contact.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of response to time of measured progressive disease up to 12.68 months
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of response (complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause. CR or PR is classified by the investigators according to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from documented SD or better to first date of progressive disease or death due to any cause up to 21.26 months
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of stable disease is defined from date of documented stable disease (SD) or better to first date of progressive disease or death from any cause (assessed every cycle during study therapy, or every 2 months during post-therapy until disease progression or death). SD is neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for partial response (PR) nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD. PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. PD is ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions and/or a new lesion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (Safety)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First treatment dose up to 43.91 months
secondary_outcome.description: Data are presented as number of participants who experienced serious adverse events or all other nonserious adverse events during the study including the 30-day follow-up period. A summary of serious adverse events and other nonserious adverse events is located in the Reported Adverse Event section.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died Due to Progressive Disease During the 30 Days Following Discontinuation From Study Treatment
other_outcome.time_frame: Study treatment discontinuation up to 30 days post study treatment discontinuation

arm_group.description: LY573636-sodium (LY573636) is administered every 28 days until disease progression or other criteria for participant discontinuation are met.

intervention.description: LY573636 dose is dependent on participant's height, weight, and gender and is adjusted to target a specific maximum concentration (Cmax) based on participant laboratory parameters. LY573636 is administered every 28 days until disease progression or other criteria for participant discontinuation are met.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of epithelial ovarian cancer, fallopian tube cancer, or primary peritoneal cancer
- At least 18 years old
- Have received at least one but no more than 2 systemic treatment regimens containing platinum (does not include regimens received before surgery for this cancer)
- Have platinum-resistant disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received more than 2 systemic treatment regimens for platinum-resistant disease
- Serious pre-existing medical conditions
- Actively receiving warfarin (Coumadin) for treatment of venous thrombosis or other prothrombotic conditions

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The reasons for discontinuation listed in the participant flow are the reasons the participant discontinued treatment and a participant was considered to have “completed” the trial if they experienced progressive disease or an adverse event.

group.title: Target Cmax 420 µg/mL
group.description: Loading dose of LY573636, targeting a maximum concentration (Cmax) of 420 micrograms/milliliter (μg/mL), followed by a lower chronic dose (which was 75% of the loading dose) in subsequent cycles, administered as an intravenous infusion given over approximately 2 hours, on Day 1 of a 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Target Cmax 360 μg/mL
group.description: Loading dose of LY573636, targeting a Cmax of 360 μg/mL, followed by a lower chronic dose (which was 90% of the loading dose) in subsequent cycles, administered as an intravenous infusion given over approximately 2 hours, on Day 1 of a 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Albumin-Tailored Dose
group.description: The dose of LY573636 administered in each infusion was based on participant's height, weight, gender, pre-cycle albumin level, and cycle number to target area under the curve above the albumin corrected threshold (AUCalb) in the range of 1200 to 6400 hour*micrograms/milliliter (h*μg/mL), administered over approximately 2 hours on Day 1 of a 28-day treatment cycle.

milestone.title: Received at Least One Dose of Study Drug

baseline.population: All enrolled participants who had at least one dose of study drug.

measurement_list.measurement: No participant had CR or PR, therefore 90% Confidence Interval was not calculable.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of LY573636
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of the study drug and had pharmacokinetics data at the specified time points.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from date of first treatment to the date of death due to any cause. For participants who were alive, overall survival was censored at their last contact.
outcome.time_frame: First treatment to death due to any cause up to 42.91 months
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. The numbers of participants censored are 11 (Target Cmax 420 µg/mL group), 6 (Target Cmax 360 µg/mL group) and 14 (Albumin-Tailored Dose group).

group.title: Target Cmax 420 µg/mL
group.description: Loading dose of LY573636, targeting a maximum concentration (Cmax) of 420 micrograms/milliliter (μg/mL), followed by a lower chronic dose (which was 75% of the loading dose) in subsequent cycles, administered as an intravenous infusion given over approximately 2 hours, on Day 1 of a 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Target Cmax 360 μg/mL
group.description: Loading dose of LY573636, targeting a Cmax of 360 μg/mL, followed by a lower chronic dose (which was 90% of the loading dose) in subsequent cycles, administered as an intravenous infusion given over approximately 2 hours, on Day 1 of a 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Albumin-Tailored Dose
group.description: The dose of LY573636 administered in each infusion was based on participant's height, weight, gender, pre-cycle albumin level, and cycle number to target area under the curve above the albumin corrected threshold (AUCalb) in the range of 1200 to 6400 hour*micrograms/milliliter (h*μg/mL), administered over approximately 2 hours on Day 1 of a 28-day treatment cycle.

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from date of first treatment to the date of death due to any cause. For participants who were alive, overall survival was censored at their last contact.
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. The numbers of participants censored are 11 (Target Cmax 420 µg/mL group), 6 (Target Cmax 360 µg/mL group) and 14 (Albumin-Tailored Dose group).

measurement_list.measurement: The upper limit of the 90% confidence interval was not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the final time point for assessment.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: The duration of response (complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause. CR or PR is classified by the investigators according to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Time of response to time of measured progressive disease up to 12.68 months
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of the study drug and had complete response (CR) or partial response (PR).

group.title: Target Cmax 420 µg/mL
group.description: Loading dose of LY573636, targeting a maximum concentration (Cmax) of 420 micrograms/milliliter (μg/mL), followed by a lower chronic dose (which was 75% of the loading dose) in subsequent cycles, administered as an intravenous infusion given over approximately 2 hours, on Day 1 of a 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Target Cmax 360 μg/mL
group.description: Loading dose of LY573636, targeting a Cmax of 360 μg/mL, followed by a lower chronic dose (which was 90% of the loading dose) in subsequent cycles, administered as an intravenous infusion given over approximately 2 hours, on Day 1 of a 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Albumin-Tailored Dose
group.description: The dose of LY573636 administered in each infusion was based on participant's height, weight, gender, pre-cycle albumin level, and cycle number to target area under the curve above the albumin corrected threshold (AUCalb) in the range of 1200 to 6400 hour*micrograms/milliliter (h*μg/mL), administered over approximately 2 hours on Day 1 of a 28-day treatment cycle.

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: The duration of response (complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause. CR or PR is classified by the investigators according to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of the study drug and had complete response (CR) or partial response (PR).

measurement_list.measurement: Only 1 participant had PR, therefore 90% Confidence Interval was not calculable.

outcome.title: Duration of Stable Disease
outcome.description: Duration of stable disease is defined from date of documented stable disease (SD) or better to first date of progressive disease or death from any cause (assessed every cycle during study therapy, or every 2 months during post-therapy until disease progression or death). SD is neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for partial response (PR) nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD. PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. PD is ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions and/or a new lesion.
outcome.time_frame: Time from documented SD or better to first date of progressive disease or death due to any cause up to 21.26 months
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of the study drug and stable disease or better.

group.title: Target Cmax 420 µg/mL
group.description: Loading dose of LY573636, targeting a maximum concentration (Cmax) of 420 micrograms/milliliter (μg/mL), followed by a lower chronic dose (which was 75% of the loading dose) in subsequent cycles, administered as an intravenous infusion given over approximately 2 hours, on Day 1 of a 21-day treatment cycle.

group.description: The dose of LY573636 administered in each infusion was based on participant's height, weight, gender, pre-cycle albumin level, and cycle number to target area under the curve above the albumin corrected threshold (AUCalb) in the range of 1200 to 6400 hour*micrograms/milliliter (h*μg/mL), administered over approximately 2 hours on Day 1 of a 28-day treatment cycle.

measure.title: Duration of Stable Disease
measure.description: Duration of stable disease is defined from date of documented stable disease (SD) or better to first date of progressive disease or death from any cause (assessed every cycle during study therapy, or every 2 months during post-therapy until disease progression or death). SD is neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for partial response (PR) nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD. PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. PD is ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions and/or a new lesion.
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of the study drug and stable disease or better.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (Safety)
outcome.description: Data are presented as number of participants who experienced serious adverse events or all other nonserious adverse events during the study including the 30-day follow-up period. A summary of serious adverse events and other nonserious adverse events is located in the Reported Adverse Event section.

reported_events.desc: Deaths due to progressive disease are not considered adverse events; however they are reported in the participant flow for those who died during the study and in the Other Pre-Specified outcome measure for those who died during the 30-day post study treatment follow-up period.

Resulted in 1 death in the Albumin-Tailored Dose arm.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
